summaryOfNewsArticle: A new legislative act, the Minors Protection Act, has been implemented to safeguard minors from online risks, including cyberbullying and harassment. The law, announced on April 15, 2024, introduces stringent penalties for online misconduct and mandates educational programs in schools to promote digital literacy and responsible behavior. The Digital Rights Commission has been established to oversee the law's enforcement, ensuring accountability and compliance. This initiative is part of a broader effort to create a safer digital environment for minors, with the Online Harassment Prevention Initiative supporting public awareness and intervention strategies.
title: New Minors Protection Act Enacts Stronger Digital Safeguards for Children
